I understand the idea and perhaps the theories of psychometric science that are quoted when justifying the existence of the app and I can fully get behind testing the idea. What I cannot get behind is using this as a tool to screen potential candidates. Solving multi armed bandit problems, impossible infinite tasks and classical prisoner dilemmas may give you insights on some of the evaluated individuals characteristics, but by no means are they a measure of what led to these specific decisions. The results of the test appear to be mostly conjecture and guesses, in many ways easy to influence by biases, algorithmic or otherwise. If this becomes the norm I would very much encourage people to learn about the classical problems I mentioned, we practice for interviews, test and exams, why should you not practice before these?
